xwikidoc.creator: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #phenotips on 31 March 2014
xwikidoc.content: <allasm> has quit 10:31 <allasm> has joined #phenotips 12:06 <bvancea> has joined #phenotips 12:24 <akats> has joined #phenotips 12:58 <akats> Michael is probably right. The approach of taking the category doesn't seem to be working too well. Going one step up the tree is probably best. 12:59 <sdumitriu> Why? 13:02 <akats> Well if the two patients are matched on the same phenotype, then it gives the category which is that phenotype. Actually now that I think about it, this is the only case for which it makes sense to go up the tree. So that's something I should do, rather than always going up the tree. 13:04 <sdumitriu> OK, sounds good 13:54 <akats> We have a slight problem. Due to recent changes in PhenoTips repo, particularly in Feature and Patient interfaces, the Patient-Network repo does not build. 13:54 <sdumitriu> Hm, working on that repo later today 13:54 <sdumitriu> The build has been failing for a week 13:54 <sdumitriu> Are you sure you have the latest version? 13:55 <akats> I just pulled it. But I'll double check. 13:55 <akats> Up to date 13:56 <sdumitriu> OK, will check really soon 13:57 <akats> I'm building the remote project for a fresh install test, should I just roll back my 13:57 <akats> PhenoTips? 13:58 <sdumitriu> What remote project? 13:58 <akats> Gene matcher 13:58 <sdumitriu> Right 13:58 <sdumitriu> Hm, no 13:58 <sdumitriu> Can it wait an hour? 13:58 <akats> Sure. I'll go for lunch then. 13:58 <akats> Perfect actually 15:41 <sdumitriu> akats: The build should be working now 15:43 <akats> Thank you! 16:03 <akats> sdumitriu: I have a few components that are trying to overwrite each other. I've deleted the duplicates (the ones that have a date attached to them), but there are still a few overwrite warnings left. Off the top of your head, any ideas? 16:16 <bvancea> has quit 16:26 <akats> sdumitriu: Has anyone built phenomecentral after all the pushes? 16:26 <sdumitriu> Only Jenkins 16:28 <akats> Well, I built it once. Added patient-network, and my stuff. Ended up with "double" header on the front page. Thinking that maybe it's something I did, I rebuilt phenomecentral and ran it by itself. Still have a double header, and got errors 16:28 <akats> com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiException: Error number 3002 in 3: The attachment could not be found in the filesystem attachment store. 16:29 <akats> All of them like this one, it seems 16:29 <sdumitriu> Right, that's a known issue 16:29 <sdumitriu> There's a bug in one of the XWiki Maven plugins 16:29 <sdumitriu> You can fix it by going to the administration, and import the full pc xar 16:30 <akats> "full pc"? As in PhenoTips? 16:31 <akats> oh phenomecentral 16:31 <sdumitriu> PhenomeCentral 16:51 <akats> Hmm... didn't fix the problem on either instances. Just to clarify, you mean to go to import and select phenomecentral.org/ui/target/*.xar and import all, correct? 16:51 <sdumitriu> Yes 17:13 <akats> This is one of these days. I tried replacing PatientSheet, all UIX files, and some others from the PhenoTips target xar, but it didn't help. I still get this error when opening the "Clinical symptoms" tab. I don't want to distract you from work, so if you'd don't have off the top of the head solution, I'll give it a go. https://gist.github.com/soLEED/44d06261aebd1c98f802 17:14 <sdumitriu> You need to update the version of commons-lang3 that's in libs 17:14 <sdumitriu> We've updated to 3.3.1 last week 17:15 <akats> Gotcha 17:24 <akats> sdumitriu: Just a heads up, the problem wasn't the new version missing, it was the old version still being there. 17:24 <sdumitriu> OK 17:24 <sdumitriu> It shouldn't be in a clean install 17:30 <sdumitriu> allasm: When disabling "Allow user tokens", pushing always fails 17:31 <sdumitriu> allasm: What's the intended behavior for that? 17:39 <sdumitriu> allasm: When updates are disabled, the Push UI should not allow that option to be selected 17:57 <mcupak> has quit 18:10 <akats> There's a bug in the "Phenotypic features breakdown", but I think it's not in my code. When looking at the breakdown, for the info for the current patient (not the remote) is "The current patient (P0000004) presented with: Undisclosed information" 18:11 <sdumitriu> Hm... 18:36 <akats> has quit 21:03 <sdumitriu> has quit 21:04 <sdumitriu> has joined #phenotips
